q14.description: The formal definition of grammar is G=(V,T,S,P) where V is a finite set of variables (nonterminals) T is a finite set of terminals (generally, these are strings). S is the start variable (S∈V) P is a set of productions (rules) in the form x→y means to replace x by y
q14.question: What does x represent?
